Metrics with User Defined Aggregations

BusinessIQ gives you the ability to aggregate your metrics by more than just Sum. For example, you might want to view the average number of shipped cases across all distributors or the maximum number of rebate claims across all contract customers. You might even be interested in calculating the standard deviation of a certain metric. BIQ gives you the ability to do so using the User Defined Aggregations feature. After selecting a metric from the columns list, simply click on the column header in the Report Definition to reveal the derived metrics and user defined aggregations menu (Derived metrics are explained later in this section). Expand the ‘Agg By:’ dropdown list to reveal the different aggregations you can use: Average, Sum, Count, Max, Min, and Standard Deviation.

 


BIQ allows you to add different aggregations of the same metric to your report. Once you have selected a metric and a specific aggregation, you can select that same metric again with a different aggregation. This is especially helpful if you are trying to compare, for example, gross cost (sum) with its average and standard deviation.
